long:
Meaning: properly, the "whole"; hence, "all", "any" or "every" (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense).
Usage: (in) all (manner, (ye)), altogether, any (manner), enough, every (one, place, thing), howsoever, as many as, (no-) thing, ought, whatsoever, (the) whole, whoso(-ever).
Source: or (Jeremiah 33:8) "כּוֹל"; from "H3634";
